text: Aleksandr Ivanovich Kazarsky () (June 16, 1797 – June 16, 1833) was a Russian Navy officer. He was the hero of the Russo-Turkish War (1828–1829). Kazarsky was the captain of brig Mercury. He became famous after the victory in the battle against two Turkish ships of the line. == Career == * Kazarsky joined the fleet in 1811. * In 1814 he became an officer. * 14 May 1829 Kazarsky won the battle against two Turkish ships. * From 26 May to 17 July 1829 Kazarsky was the Captain of frigate Pospeshny. * From 1831 to 1833 Kazarsky was a member of the retinue of Nicholas I of Russia. * In 1833 he was poisoned. A brig and a torpedo boat were named after Alexander Kazarsky. Category:1797 births Category:1833 deaths Category:Russian military people
title: Alexander Kazarsky
